name: Intermediate - Trading Applications
description: Practical application of ICT concepts for trade entries and management

rules.title: Order Block Entry
rules.when_condition: Price returns to order block level
rules.rule_text: Enter trades when price returns to an order block with confirmation from lower timeframe. Look for rejection at the level, not just arrival.
validation_questions: When should you enter an order block trade?
Why not enter on arrival alone?
examples: 15min rejection candle at 1H bullish order block

rules.title: FVG Trading Direction
rules.rule_text: Trade in the direction of the displacement that created the fair value gap. Bearish FVGs are resistance, bullish FVGs are support.
validation_questions: Which direction should you trade an FVG?
What is a bearish FVG's function?
What is a bullish FVG's function?
examples: Bullish displacement creates bullish FVG - trade long on return
Bearish displacement creates bearish FVG - trade short on return

rules.title: Liquidity Sweep Entry
rules.rule_text: Enter opposite to the sweep direction after liquidity is taken. If buy stops are hit above highs, look for short opportunities as price reverses.
validation_questions: How do you trade a liquidity sweep?
What happens after buy stops are taken?
Why trade opposite to the sweep?
examples: Price sweeps above highs, then reverses down - go short
Price sweeps below lows, then reverses up - go long

learning_objectives: Execute order block entries with confirmation
Trade fair value gaps in correct direction
Use liquidity sweeps for entry timing
